premises: If an athlete trains consistently, then their performance improves
The athlete's performance does not improve
conclusions: The athlete does not train consistently
incorrect conclusions: The athlete trains consistently and their performance improves
The athlete's performance improving implies they train consistently
If the athlete's performance does not improve, then they train consistently
If the athlete does not train consistently, then their performance does not improve

premises: If a team has good teamwork, then they win more games
The team does not win more games
conclusions: The team does not have good teamwork
incorrect conclusions: The team has good teamwork and wins more games
The team winning more games implies they have good teamwork
If the team does not win more games, then they have good teamwork
If the team does not have good teamwork, then they do not win more games

premises: If a player stretches before exercise, then they reduce their risk of injury
The player does not reduce their risk of injury
conclusions: The player does not stretch before exercise
incorrect conclusions: The player stretches before exercise and reduces their risk of injury
Reducing their risk of injury implies the player stretches before exercise
If the player does not reduce their risk of injury, then they stretch before exercise
If the player does not stretch before exercise, then they do not reduce their risk of injury
